NewsLines.HeadLine: Belarus detains activists on vote anniversary

body.content.p: Belarus police arrested more than 20 activists Monday who tried to stage a banned candlelight vigil marking the first anniversary of strongman Alexander Lukashenko's contested re-election.

An AFP correspondent on Independence Square in central Minsk saw plainclothes security agents grab about 20 men and women who were holding portraits of political prisoners detained on election night one year ago.
Some screamed and kicked as police dragged them along the ground to security vans waiting on the edge of the square.
The Vyasna rights organisation said on its website that agents from the KGB security services had also detained four other prominent opposition leaders as they headed for the unsanctioned event.
The website of the Belarus Christian Democrat party also said that police detained their leader Vital Rymasheuski as he was leaving his apartment.

Nearly 50,000 people rallied in the bitter winter cold a year ago when Lukashenko was declared winner of a fraud-tainted ballot in which each of his nine rivals was awarded less than three percent of the vote.

The show of fury at the veteran leader's regime led to more than 700 arrests and the imprisonment of six candidates in a crackdown that broke all Western efforts to repair relations with the isolated ex-Soviet state.
